title: Show, Don't Tell
content: Instead of stating a character's emotion, describe their actions and physical reactions. For example, instead of 'He was angry', write 'He clenched his fists and his face turned red'.

title: Active Voice
content: Use the active voice to make your sentences stronger and more direct. In active voice, the subject performs the action. Passive: 'The ball was thrown by the boy.' Active: 'The boy threw the ball.'

title: Vary Sentence Length
content: Mix short and long sentences to create rhythm and keep the reader engaged. Short sentences add punch. Long sentences add flow.

title: Avoid Adverbs
content: Strong verbs are better than weak verbs with adverbs. Instead of 'ran quickly', use 'sprinted'. Instead of 'said loudly', use 'shouted'.

title: Kill Your Darlings
content: Be willing to cut scenes or characters that don't serve the story, even if you love them. Every element must advance the plot or reveal character.
